Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[2FA] Enable 2FA by default for new accounts" (#9033) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- All new accounts won't be able to link their account (and unable to register) if the account doesn't have 2FA enabled.
- Current users won't be able to enable to link new accounts if that account doesn't have 2FA enabled.
- Enable/Disable button for changing 2FA status on Account Settings page will only show Enable so users can still follow that flow if they want to enable it before enforcement.


Addresses:
- https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4235
- https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4236

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[2FA] Enable 2FA by default for new accounts" (#9033) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[A11y] Improved contrast of focus outline on elements in the header and footer" (#9032) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8986

**Problem:**

On NuGet.org, when navigating a page using the keyboard (tab key), elements in the navbar and footer were given a black outline, which had a low contrast ratio with the blue background.

**Previous version**

Header:
![Old, navbar](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156483103-fe4370dc-5fe4-4831-98d3-021b07b662c9.gif)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156484206-fe49f7da-b4fd-4357-80cf-e54c7938a768.png)

Footer:
![Old, footer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156483117-b58d29a4-3015-41ad-8776-b8653664a170.gif)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156484502-a82b2f10-314e-44bb-83d8-6a1729bff731.png)


**Fix:**

To fix this, I changed the focus outline to white.

After making the changes:

**New version**

Header:
![New, navbar](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156483142-a30f06a0-3546-46ff-ad99-344078424a75.gif)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156484341-f4a1c557-20ae-4694-a01f-0fbd15280108.png)

Footer:
![New, footer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156483149-334513ef-d62b-41e0-9f22-b14705087769.gif)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156484588-832ae602-3076-453a-ab99-84bdd6395e0d.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[A11y] Improved contrast of buttons when in tab focus mode" (#9031) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8987

_Note:_ One of the original problems called out in the [a11y bug](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468969) was related to the contrast between the search sign and the white background (the search bar), but it looks like the wrong background color was selected in their tests, and I could not reproduce it while using Accessibility Insights myself.

Their screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466090-cabbae21-3474-4382-9b91-70ce1e361529.png)

When I looked into it:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466171-7a646b39-2aaa-4df6-858b-51dfdd718cff.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466221-101580df-46a3-48dd-97c0-9094232b070e.png)

However, there were other accessibility concerns because of contrast ratios here, which I've tried to fix.

**Problem:**

On NuGet.org, when navigating a page using the keyboard (tab key), buttons would get a black outline and would darken their original color. This reduced the contrast on certain buttons like the Search button in the navbar and the Send button on the Forgot Password page (with respect to the tab focus outline, and in some cases other surrounding colors in the backdrop)

Previous version (Search):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156465861-8d6a6f5b-8c57-4e9b-a04f-a5e70423711e.png)  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156465819-ba78de01-95db-45b2-ad33-3695d7d4ec73.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466569-eaa0edd7-b433-46ee-a4c4-87caebb4e750.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466794-53da64c6-2e60-4606-9185-9ea618f481fd.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466843-1b0c24c6-3c01-4830-9822-cc4fcd4062a6.png)

Previous version (Send button on Forgot Password page):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466878-e3117931-bbdc-4b48-aaab-4c07a48c8d5c.png)  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156466899-2153e3df-db8d-4ca3-8d4e-2180da88f0ca.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467095-ba51a40e-43d0-41a3-b432-cbd10a1c4a2f.png)


**Fix:**

To fix this, I removed the darkening effect when in tab focus. The outline still highlights the element distinctly, and has higher contrast ratios with the original button colors.

After making the changes:

New version (Search):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467350-cc85c145-b985-4ea8-acd1-d4d39a3847f2.png)  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467326-941db588-4a2c-48d6-b921-dcd144bcebdb.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467504-192a9457-91fd-4793-8567-2c3a5ac11ed8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467415-553609ce-c31e-4539-a39e-f6a332eb99fc.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467585-2883143f-3042-41b4-ad09-6a73d111906e.png)

New version (Send button on Forgot Password page):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467839-bd4da740-22a2-4877-801a-82ff3b031fd5.png)  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467862-9c7b2088-8d7f-47f0-9a41-fb5d5184537a.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/156467986-bd161f70-f13e-4afe-8cf8-25b483dcb74b.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add additional text to use of online safety categories in report package form" (#8899) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Add this text above the details box when a safety category is chosen:

Please also describe where in the package the problem was found. 

Be sure to include:
-	Whether the problem is in graphics, video, readme, scripts, libraries, nuspec, other metadata, other file(s).
-	The exact names of the offending file(s).


/cc @jcjiang

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Frameworks not displayed for SpecFlow NuGet package" (#9030) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

Other

### Describe the bug

The Framework tab of our main NuGet packages is empty.

### Repro Steps

Look at package pages of
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/SpecFlow/
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/SpecFlow.NUnit/
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/SpecFlow.MsTest/
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/SpecFlow.xUnit/

Switch to `Frameworks` Tab

Nothing is displayed

### Expected Behavior

Supported Frameworks are displayed.

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/859801/156369568-14ebcd37-a66d-43b7-96ed-c93c186a0708.png)


### Additional Context and logs

Our NuGet packages are doing more than your standard NuGet Packages, so perhaps something of this breaks the detection.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep] RI dev to main" (#9027) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Feature]: Deep link Release Notes and show in Package Manager" (#9029) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

Release Notes seems like a good place to put important information about changes in the current release but this isn't very visible.  It doesn't appear when the package is selected in the VS Package Explorer, and I can't deeplink to it.

There's already a hash link for the tab, but it doesn't activate the tab: https://www.nuget.org/packages/SerratedSharp.SerratedJQ.Lite#releasenotes-tab 

### The Elevator Pitch

In documentation I find myself putting things like "For current compatibility information visit *Nuget link* and click the right Release Notes tab" which has unnecessary exposition rather than what would be more straightforward "For current compatibility information see *Nuget link*". 

To accomplish this, make the hash link deep link directly to Release Notes tab, so that we can link directly to the tab from other places:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/SerratedSharp.SerratedJQ.Lite#releasenotes-tab

Also consider showing the Release Notes as a section in the VS Package Manager when the package is selected.  I.e. in the panel where Description, Version, License, etc. is shown.

Typically Release Notes would contain information about breaking changes which would warrant it being much more visible.


### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[A11y]Fix Graph on stats for narrow screen." (#9028) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Disables removing the chart when screen in very narrow.
Moves the title out of the chart itself since chart no longer is removed. This also improves readability of the title.

Old:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/156249413-1d900878-47a2-4563-b016-5f58f0084f83.png)

New:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/156249472-eaa234e4-b7c6-4ad2-9ee3-6d218f8f10bc.png)

Note difference in displayed data comes from dev vs public.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Help Us Improve Our Open Source Repositories!" (#8980) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We'd love to hear from those of you who participate often in our open source project and let us know how we're doing as maintainers.

Whether you've been involved for awhile now or you're relatively new to open source, please let us know about your experience by [taking a survey that will take a couple minutes](https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/8QTQTGJ?Source=NugetGallery).

Thank you kindly!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Null Reference exception when loading/refresh any Tab of the PM UI" (#11644) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Version 17.2.0 Preview 2.0 [32222.421.main]

### Worked before?

17.2.0 Preview 2.0

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Using a new solution, I incidentally stumbled upon a null reference exception in PM UI. I've identified the location in the code already below.

Filed VS Feedback: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/object-reference-null-when-opening-package-manager/1683498

I'm assuming for now that it's a regression, as this code was changed recently in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4119
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/156683251-76eaba45-dfad-4108-a857-4a7d8748c339.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/156683122-cfa83abd-ab41-4361-b9b9-7012fbccb004.png)

Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

any

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

Other

### Repro Steps & Context

There are several strings that I don't see referenced. 
Check `NuGet.Client\src\NuGet.Clients\NuGet.PackageManagement.UI\Resources.Designer.cs`
and remove any unnecessary strings.

For examples:

- I removed `Text_LicenseAcceptance` in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4257/files#r705597868.
- `Text_ChangesForProject` has no references
- etc

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Locked mode restore does not work as soon as there is another project in the same solution" (#11642) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

dotnet 6.0.200

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Extract example project 
[HelloWorldOfPackageLockFiles_buggy.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/8178845/HelloWorldOfPackageLockFiles_buggy.zip)

2. Run `dotnet restore --locked-mode` inside the example project
3. Get error 
```
C:\Users\stw\work\HelloWorldOfPackageLockFiles_buggy\Tests\Tests.csproj : error NU1004: Das Projekt verweist auf "hellow
orldofpackagelockfiles", deren Abh√§ngigkeiten ge√§ndert wurden.Die Paketsperrdatei stimmt nicht mit den Projektabh√§ngigke
iten √ºberein, daher kann die Wiederherstellung nicht im gesperrten Modus ausgef√ºhrt werden. Deaktivieren Sie die MSBuild
-Eigenschaft "RestoreLockedMode", oder √ºbergeben Sie eine explizite Option "--force-evaluate", um die Sperrdatei zu aktu
alisieren. [C:\Users\stw\work\HelloWorldOfPackageLockFiles_buggy\HelloWorldOfPackageLockFiles.sln]
```

Log of `dotnet restore --locked-mode --verbosity diag` in
[diag.log](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/8178837/diag.log)




### Verbose Logs

```shell
See repro steps, its in the attachments there
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Spec update: Transitive Dependencies from project references" (#11640) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Following-up on comment: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4465#discussion_r816133121

- Updates Transitive Dependencies specs to reflect decisions made on Transitive Dependencies in PM UI.
- Documents tracking issue for CLI experience with transitive dependencies from referenced projects.
- Documents tracking issue for project PM UI experience with transitive dependencies from referenced projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]:Version combo box is not editable in C# Console Application (.NET Framework) ‚Äì PackageReference project" (#11620) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

PM UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client dev-martinrrm-fix-versions-combobox\6.2.0.452

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Repro Steps & Context

## Repro steps
1. Create a new C# Console Application (.net framework) project.
2. Right-click the project and select ‚ÄòManage NuGet Packages‚Ä¶‚Äô menu item in Solution Explorer.
3. Click settings button, check ‚ÄòAllow format selection on first package install‚Äô in General tab, select 'PackageReference' in the ‚ÄòDefault package management format‚Äô combo box and click OK.
4. Go to ‚ÄòBrowse‚Äô tab, click some packages (e.g.Newtonsoft.Json) and start typing a version in the version list.

## Expected
Version combo box is editable in C# Console Application (.NET Framework) ‚Äì PackageReference project.

## Actual
Version combo box is not editable in C# Console Application (.NET Framework) ‚Äì PackageReference project as below screenshot.
![Record](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/155710346-21813537-bb48-4376-88c6-79cd2e52b5b7.gif)
## Note
1. The issue does not repro on C# Console App (.NET Core) project.
2. It is a regression bug, start to repro from dev-martinrrm-fix-versions-combobox\6.2.0.452.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
